intro: Argyrochaeta, commonly known as silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. These plants are characterized by their silver or grayish foliage, which is covered in fine, reflective hairs. Argyrochaeta species are typically shrubs or small trees, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. They produce small, usually yellow or white flowers that are followed by berries containing toxic seeds. The genus is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, sunny conditions.
